description.html: Opens the print dialog to print the current document.
description.text: Opens the print dialog to print the current document.

description.html: window.alert() instructs the browser to display a dialog with an optional message, and to wait until the user dismisses the dialog.
description.text: window.alert() instructs the browser to display a dialog with an optional message, and to wait until the user dismisses the dialog.

description.html: Shifts focus away from the window.
description.text: Shifts focus away from the window.

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The open() method of the Window interface loads a specified resource into a new or existing browsing context (that is, a tab, a window, or an iframe) under a specified name.
description.text: The open() method of the Window interface loads a specified resource into a new or existing browsing context (that is, a tab, a window, or an iframe) under a specified name.

description.html: The resize event fires when the document view (window) has been resized.
description.text: The resize event fires when the document view (window) has been resized.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The gamepaddisconnected event is fired when the browser detects that a gamepad has been disconnected.
description.text: The gamepaddisconnected event is fired when the browser detects that a gamepad has been disconnected.

Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html:
Experimental: This is an experimental technology
Check the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production.
description.text: Experimental: This is an experimental technologyCheck the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production.

description.html: This method clears the action specified by window.setImmediate.
description.text: This method clears the action specified by window.setImmediate.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The window.cancelIdleCallback() method cancels a callback previously scheduled with window.requestIdleCallback().
description.text:
The window.cancelIdleCallback() method cancels a callback
  previously scheduled with window.requestIdleCallback().

description.html: The Window.outerHeight read-only property returns the height in pixels of the whole browser window, including any sidebar, window chrome, and window-resizing borders/handles.
description.text: The Window.outerHeight read-only property returns the height in pixels of the whole browser window, including any sidebar, window chrome, and window-resizing borders/handles.

description.html: The window.stop() stops further resource loading in the current browsing context, equivalent to the stop button in the browser.
description.text:
The window.stop() stops further resource loading in the current
  browsing context, equivalent to the stop button in the browser.

description.html: The languagechange event is fired at the global scope object when the user's preferred language changes.
description.text: The languagechange event is fired at the global scope object when the user's preferred language changes.

description.html: The global clearInterval() method cancels a timed, repeating action which was previously established by a call to setInterval(). If the parameter provided does not identify a previously established action, this method does nothing.
description.text:
The global clearInterval() method cancels a timed, repeating action which
  was previously established by a call to setInterval().
  If the parameter provided does not identify a previously established action,
  this method does nothing.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The rejectionhandled event is sent to the script's global scope (usually window but also Worker) whenever a rejected JavaScript Promise is handled late, i.e. when a handler is attached to the promise after its rejection had caused an unhandledrejection event.
description.text: The rejectionhandled event is sent to the script's global scope (usually window but also Worker) whenever a rejected JavaScript Promise is handled late, i.e. when a handler is attached to the promise after its rejection had caused an unhandledrejection event.

description.html: The error event is fired on a Window object when a resource failed to load or couldn't be used — for example if a script has an execution error.
description.text: The error event is fired on a Window object when a resource failed to load or couldn't be used — for example if a script has an execution error.

description.html: The window.cancelAnimationFrame() method cancels an animation frame request previously scheduled through a call to window.requestAnimationFrame().
description.text:
The window.cancelAnimationFrame() method cancels an
  animation frame request previously scheduled through a call to
  window.requestAnimationFrame().

description.html: Returns a reference to the topmost window in the window hierarchy.
description.text: Returns a reference to the topmost window in the window hierarchy.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The message event is fired on a Window object when the window receives a message, for example from a call to Window.postMessage() from another browsing context.
description.text: The message event is fired on a Window object when the window receives a message, for example from a call to Window.postMessage() from another browsing context.

description.html: The animationend event is fired when a CSS Animation has completed. If the animation aborts before reaching completion, such as if the element is removed from the DOM or the animation is removed from the element, the animationend event is not fired.
description.text: The animationend event is fired when a CSS Animation has completed. If the animation aborts before reaching completion, such as if the element is removed from the DOM or the animation is removed from the element, the animationend event is not fired.

description.html: The load event is fired when the whole page has loaded, including all dependent resources such as stylesheets, scripts, iframes, and images. This is in contrast to DOMContentLoaded, which is fired as soon as the page DOM has been loaded, without waiting for resources to finish loading.
description.text:
The load event is fired when the whole page has loaded, including all dependent resources such as stylesheets, scripts, iframes, and images.
  This is in contrast to DOMContentLoaded, which is fired as soon as the page DOM has been loaded, without waiting for resources to finish loading.

description.html: The Window.getComputedStyle() method returns an object containing the values of all CSS properties of an element, after applying active stylesheets and resolving any basic computation those values may contain.
description.text:
The
  Window.getComputedStyle() method returns an object
  containing the values of all CSS properties of an element, after applying active
  stylesheets and resolving any basic computation those values may contain.

description.html: Makes a request to bring the window to the front. It may fail due to user settings and the window isn't guaranteed to be frontmost before this method returns.
description.text: Makes a request to bring the window to the front. It may fail due to user settings and the window isn't guaranteed to be frontmost before this method returns.

description.html: The devicePixelRatio of Window interface returns the ratio of the resolution in physical pixels to the resolution in CSS pixels for the current display device.
description.text:
The devicePixelRatio of
  Window interface returns the ratio of the resolution in physical
pixels to the resolution in CSS pixels for the current display
  device.

description.html: The Window property screen returns a reference to the screen object associated with the window. The screen object, implementing the Screen interface, is a special object for inspecting properties of the screen on which the current window is being rendered.
description.text:
The Window property screen returns a
  reference to the screen object associated with the window. The screen
  object, implementing the Screen interface, is a special object for
  inspecting properties of the screen on which the current window is being rendered.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The window.postMessage() method safely enables cross-origin communication between Window objects; e.g., between a page and a pop-up that it spawned, or between a page and an iframe embedded within it.
description.text:
The window.postMessage() method safely enables
  cross-origin communication between Window objects; e.g., between
  a page and a pop-up that it spawned, or between a page and an iframe embedded within it.

description.html: The unhandledrejection event is sent to the global scope of a script when a JavaScript Promise that has no rejection handler is rejected; typically, this is the window, but may also be a Worker.
description.text: The unhandledrejection event is sent to the global scope of a script when a JavaScript Promise that has no rejection handler is rejected; typically, this is the window, but may also be a Worker.

description.html:
Experimental: This is an experimental technology
Check the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production.
description.text: Experimental: This is an experimental technologyCheck the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production.

description.html: The DOM StaticRange interface extends AbstractRange to provide a method to specify a range of content in the DOM whose contents don't update to reflect changes which occur within the DOM tree.
description.text: The DOM StaticRange interface extends AbstractRange to provide a method to specify a range of content in the DOM whose contents don't update to reflect changes which occur within the DOM tree.

description.html: The Window.getSelection() method returns a Selection object representing the range of text selected by the user or the current position of the caret.
description.text:
The Window.getSelection() method returns a
  Selection object representing the range of text selected by the user or
  the current position of the caret.

description.html: The pagehide event is sent to a Window when the browser hides the current page in the process of presenting a different page from the session's history.
description.text: The pagehide event is sent to a Window when the browser hides the current page in the process of presenting a different page from the session's history.

description.html:
Returns the window itself, which is an array-like object, listing the direct sub-frames
  of the current window.
description.text:
Returns the window itself, which is an array-like object, listing the direct sub-frames
  of the current window.

description.html: The messageerror event is fired on a Window object when it receives a message that can't be deserialized.
description.text: The messageerror event is fired on a Window object when it receives a message that can't be deserialized.

description.html: The read-only Window property pageXOffset is an alias for scrollX.
description.text: The read-only Window property pageXOffset is an alias for scrollX.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The focus event fires when an element has received focus.
description.text: The focus event fires when an element has received focus.

description.html: The moveBy() method of the Window interface moves the current window by a specified amount.
description.text:
The moveBy() method of the Window
  interface moves the current window by a specified amount.

description.html: The popstate event of the Window interface is fired when the active history entry changes while the user navigates the session history. It changes the current history entry to that of the last page the user visited or, if history.pushState() has been used to add a history entry to the history stack, that history entry is used instead.
description.text: The popstate event of the Window interface is fired when the active history entry changes while the user navigates the session history. It changes the current history entry to that of the last page the user visited or, if history.pushState() has been used to add a history entry to the history stack, that history entry is used instead.

description.html: Window.scrollTo() scrolls to a particular set of coordinates in the document.
description.text:
Window.scrollTo() scrolls to a particular set of
  coordinates in the document.

description.html: The Window.scrollBy() method scrolls the document in the window by the given amount.
description.text:
The Window.scrollBy() method scrolls the document in the
  window by the given amount.

description.html: The Window.resizeBy() method resizes the current window by a specified amount.
description.text:
The Window.resizeBy() method resizes the current window
  by a specified amount.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The Window.resizeTo() method dynamically resizes the window.
description.text:
The Window.resizeTo() method dynamically resizes the
  window.

description.html: The Window interface's matchMedia() method returns a new MediaQueryList object that can then be used to determine if the document matches the media query string, as well as to monitor the document to detect when it matches (or stops matching) that media query.
description.text:
The Window interface's matchMedia() method
  returns a new MediaQueryList object that can then be used to determine if
  the document matches the media query string,
  as well as to monitor the document to detect when it matches (or stops matching) that
  media query.

description.html: The atob() function decodes a string of data which has been encoded using Base64 encoding. You can use the btoa() method to encode and transmit data which may otherwise cause communication problems, then transmit it and use the atob() method to decode the data again. For example, you can encode, transmit, and decode control characters such as ASCII values 0 through 31.
description.text:
The atob() function decodes a
  string of data which has been encoded using Base64 encoding. You can use
  the btoa() method to encode and transmit
  data which may otherwise cause communication problems, then transmit it and use the
  atob() method to decode the data again. For example, you can encode,
  transmit, and decode control characters such as ASCII values 0 through 31.

description.html: The transitionend event is fired when a CSS transition has completed. In the case where a transition is removed before completion, such as if the transition-property is removed or display is set to none, then the event will not be generated.
description.text: The transitionend event is fired when a CSS transition has completed. In the case where a transition is removed before completion, such as if the transition-property is removed or display is set to none, then the event will not be generated.

description.html: window.document returns a reference to the document contained in the window.
description.text: window.document returns a reference to the document contained in the window.

description.html: Warning: Developers should avoid using this event. See "Usage notes" below.
description.text: Warning: Developers should avoid using this event. See "Usage notes" below.

description.html: The Window.frameElement property returns the element (such as <iframe> or <object>) in which the window is embedded.
description.text:
The Window.frameElement property
  returns the element (such as <iframe> or <object>)
  in which the window is embedded.

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.
description.text: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The pointerdown event is fired when a pointer becomes active. For mouse, it is fired when the device transitions from no buttons pressed to at least one button pressed. For touch, it is fired when physical contact is made with the digitizer. For pen, it is fired when the stylus makes physical contact with the digitizer.
description.text: The pointerdown event is fired when a pointer becomes active. For mouse, it is fired when the device transitions from no buttons pressed to at least one button pressed. For touch, it is fired when physical contact is made with the digitizer. For pen, it is fired when the stylus makes physical contact with the digitizer.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The global clearTimeout() method cancels a timeout previously established by calling setTimeout().
description.text:
The global clearTimeout() method cancels a timeout previously established
  by calling setTimeout().

description.html: The Window.navigator read-only property returns a reference to the Navigator object, which has methods and properties about the application running the script.
description.text:
The Window.navigator read-only property returns a
  reference to the Navigator object, which has methods and properties about
  the application running the script.

description.html: The global fetch() method starts the process of fetching a resource from the network, returning a promise which is fulfilled once the response is available.
description.text:
The global fetch() method starts the process of fetching a
  resource from the network, returning a promise which is fulfilled once the response is
  available.

description.html: The global structuredClone() method creates a deep clone of a given value using the structured clone algorithm.
description.text: The global structuredClone() method creates a deep clone of a given value using the structured clone algorithm.

description.html: The moveTo() method of the Window interface moves the current window to the specified coordinates.
description.text:
The moveTo() method of the Window
  interface moves the current window to the specified coordinates.

description.html: The global setTimeout() method sets a timer which executes a function or specified piece of code once the timer expires.
description.text:
The global setTimeout() method sets a timer which executes a function or specified
  piece of code once the timer expires.

description.html: The global crossOriginIsolated read-only property returns a boolean value that indicates whether a SharedArrayBuffer can be sent via a Window.postMessage() call.
description.text:
The global crossOriginIsolated read-only property returns a boolean value that
  indicates whether a SharedArrayBuffer can be sent via a
  Window.postMessage() call.

description.html: The Window.close() method closes the current window, or the window on which it was called.
description.text:
The Window.close() method closes the current window, or
  the window on which it was called.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The Window.history read-only property returns a reference to the History object, which provides an interface for manipulating the browser session history (pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in).
description.text: The Window.history read-only property returns a reference to the History object, which provides an interface for manipulating the browser session history (pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in).

description.html: window.confirm() instructs the browser to display a dialog with an optional message, and to wait until the user either confirms or cancels the dialog.
description.text: window.confirm() instructs the browser to display a dialog with an optional message, and to wait until the user either confirms or cancels the dialog.

description.html: The read-only Window property pageYOffset is an alias for scrollY; as such, it returns the number of pixels the document is currently scrolled along the vertical axis (that is, up or down) with a value of 0.0, indicating that the top edge of the Document is currently aligned with the top edge of the window's content area.
description.text:
The read-only Window property pageYOffset
  is an alias for scrollY; as such, it returns the number
  of pixels the document is currently scrolled along the vertical axis (that is, up or
  down) with a value of 0.0, indicating that the top edge of the Document
  is currently aligned with the top edge of the window's content area.

description.html: window.prompt() instructs the browser to display a dialog with an optional message prompting the user to input some text, and to wait until the user either submits the text or cancels the dialog.
description.text: window.prompt() instructs the browser to display a dialog with an optional message prompting the user to input some text, and to wait until the user either submits the text or cancels the dialog.

description.html: Secure context: This feature is available only in secure contexts (HTTPS), in some or all supporting browsers.
description.text: Secure context: This feature is available only in secure contexts (HTTPS), in some or all supporting browsers.

description.html: The devicemotion event is fired at a regular interval and indicates the amount of physical force of acceleration the device is receiving at that time. It also provides information about the rate of rotation, if available.
description.text: The devicemotion event is fired at a regular interval and indicates the amount of physical force of acceleration the device is receiving at that time. It also provides information about the rate of rotation, if available.

description.html: Returns the number of frames (either <frame> or <iframe> elements) in the window.
description.text:
Returns the number of frames (either <frame> or
  <iframe> elements) in the window.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The Window.screenX read-only property returns the horizontal distance, in CSS pixels, of the left border of the user's browser viewport to the left side of the screen.
description.text:
The Window.screenX read-only property returns the
  horizontal distance, in CSS pixels, of the left border of the user's browser viewport to
  the left side of the screen.

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.
description.text: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The securitypolicyviolation event is fired when a Content Security Policy is violated.
description.text: The securitypolicyviolation event is fired when a Content Security Policy is violated.

description.html: The btoa() method creates a Base64-encoded ASCII string from a binary string (i.e., a string in which each character in the string is treated as a byte of binary data).
description.text:
The btoa() method creates a
  Base64-encoded ASCII string from a binary string (i.e., a
  string in which each character in the string is treated as a byte
  of binary data).

description.html: The global caches read-only property returns the CacheStorage object associated with the current context. This object enables functionality such as storing assets for offline use, and generating custom responses to requests.
description.text:
The global caches read-only property returns the CacheStorage object associated with the current context.
  This object enables functionality such as storing assets for offline use, and generating custom responses to requests.

description.html: The customElements read-only property of the Window interface returns a reference to the CustomElementRegistry object, which can be used to register new custom elements and get information about previously registered custom elements.
description.text: The customElements read-only property of the Window interface returns a reference to the CustomElementRegistry object, which can be used to register new custom elements and get information about previously registered custom elements.

description.html: The Window.name property gets/sets the name of the window's browsing context.
description.text:
The Window.name property
  gets/sets the name of the window's browsing context.

description.html: The dblclick event fires when a pointing device button (such as a mouse's primary button) is double-clicked; that is, when it's rapidly clicked twice on a single element within a very short span of time.
description.text: The dblclick event fires when a pointing device button (such as a mouse's primary button) is double-clicked; that is, when it's rapidly clicked twice on a single element within a very short span of time.

description.html: The Window.toolbar property returns the toolbar object, which can be used to check the browser toolbar visibility.
description.text:
The Window.toolbar property returns the toolbar object,
  which can be used to check the browser toolbar visibility.

description.html: The Window.scroll() method scrolls the window to a particular place in the document.
description.text:
The Window.scroll() method scrolls the window to a
  particular place in the document.

description.html: The read-only sessionStorage property accesses a session Storage object for the current origin. sessionStorage is similar to localStorage; the difference is that while data in localStorage doesn't expire, data in sessionStorage is cleared when the page session ends.
description.text:
The read-only sessionStorage
  property accesses a session Storage object for the current
  origin. sessionStorage is similar to
  localStorage; the difference is that while data
  in localStorage doesn't expire, data in sessionStorage is
  cleared when the page session ends.

description.html: The createImageBitmap() method creates a bitmap from a given source, optionally cropped to contain only a portion of that source. The method exists on the global scope in both windows and workers. It accepts a variety of different image sources, and returns a Promise which resolves to an ImageBitmap.
description.text:
The createImageBitmap() method creates a bitmap from a
  given source, optionally cropped to contain only a portion of that source. The method
  exists on the global scope in both windows and workers. It accepts a variety of
  different image sources, and returns a Promise which resolves to an
  ImageBitmap.

description.html: The Window.screenLeft read-only property returns the horizontal distance, in CSS pixels, from the left border of the user's browser viewport to the left side of the screen.
description.text:
The Window.screenLeft read-only property returns the
  horizontal distance, in CSS pixels, from the left border of the user's browser viewport
  to the left side of the screen.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The read-only scrollY property of the Window interface returns the number of pixels that the document is currently scrolled vertically.
description.text:
The read-only scrollY property
  of the Window interface returns the number of pixels that the document
  is currently scrolled vertically.

description.html: The Window interface's opener property returns a reference to the window that opened the window, either with open(), or by navigating a link with a target attribute.
description.text:
The Window interface's
  opener property returns a reference to the window that
  opened the window, either with open(), or by navigating
  a link with a target attribute.

description.html: Returns the locationbar object, whose visibility can be checked.
description.text: Returns the locationbar object, whose visibility can be checked.

description.html: The Window.menubar property returns the menubar object, whose visibility can be checked.
description.text:
The Window.menubar property returns the
  menubar object, whose visibility can be checked.

description.html: The mouseleave event is fired at an Element when the cursor of a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved out of it.
description.text: The mouseleave event is fired at an Element when the cursor of a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved out of it.

description.html: The transitioncancel event is fired when a CSS transition is canceled.
description.text: The transitioncancel event is fired when a CSS transition is canceled.

description.html: The blur event fires when an element has lost focus.
description.text: The blur event fires when an element has lost focus.

description.html: The transitionrun event is fired when a CSS transition is first created, i.e. before any transition-delay has begun.
description.text: The transitionrun event is fired when a CSS transition is first created, i.e. before any transition-delay has begun.

description.html: The read-only Window property innerWidth returns the interior width of the window in pixels. This includes the width of the vertical scroll bar, if one is present.
description.text:
The read-only Window property
  innerWidth returns the interior width of the window in
  pixels. This includes the width of the vertical scroll bar, if one is present.

description.html: The Window.screenY read-only property returns the vertical distance, in CSS pixels, of the top border of the user's browser viewport to the top edge of the screen.
description.text: The Window.screenY read-only property returns the vertical distance, in CSS pixels, of the top border of the user's browser viewport to the top edge of the screen.

description.html: The visualViewport read-only property of the Window interface returns a VisualViewport object representing the visual viewport for a given window.
description.text:
The visualViewport read-only property of the
  Window interface returns a VisualViewport object
  representing the visual viewport for a given window.

description.html: The global read-only crypto property returns the Crypto object associated to the global object. This object allows web pages access to certain cryptographic related services.
description.text: The global read-only crypto property returns the Crypto object associated to the global object. This object allows web pages access to certain cryptographic related services.

description.html: The removeEventListener() method of the EventTarget interface removes an event listener previously registered with EventTarget.addEventListener() from the target. The event listener to be removed is identified using a combination of the event type, the event listener function itself, and various optional options that may affect the matching process; see Matching event listeners for removal.
description.text:
The removeEventListener() method of the EventTarget interface
  removes an event listener previously registered with EventTarget.addEventListener() from the target.
  The event listener to be removed is identified using a combination of the event type,
  the event listener function itself, and various optional options that may affect the matching process;
  see Matching event listeners for removal.

description.html: The queueMicrotask() method, which is exposed on the Window or Worker interface, queues a microtask to be executed at a safe time prior to control returning to the browser's event loop.
description.text:
The queueMicrotask() method,
  which is exposed on the Window or Worker interface,
  queues a microtask to be executed at a safe time prior to control returning to the
  browser's event loop.

description.html: The Window.self read-only property returns the window itself, as a WindowProxy. It can be used with dot notation on a window object (that is, window.self) or standalone (self). The advantage of the standalone notation is that a similar notation exists for non-window contexts, such as in Web Workers. By using self, you can refer to the global scope in a way that will work not only in a window context (self will resolve to window.self) but also in a worker context (self will then resolve to WorkerGlobalScope.self).
description.text: The Window.self read-only property returns the window itself, as a WindowProxy. It can be used with dot notation on a window object (that is, window.self) or standalone (self). The advantage of the standalone notation is that a similar notation exists for non-window contexts, such as in Web Workers. By using self, you can refer to the global scope in a way that will work not only in a window context (self will resolve to window.self) but also in a worker context (self will then resolve to WorkerGlobalScope.self).

description.html: Returns the personalbar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.
description.text:
Returns the personalbar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the
  window.

description.html: An element receives a click event when a pointing device button (such as a mouse's primary mouse button) is both pressed and released while the pointer is located inside the element.
description.text: An element receives a click event when a pointing device button (such as a mouse's primary mouse button) is both pressed and released while the pointer is located inside the element.

description.html: The read-only scrollX property of the Window interface returns the number of pixels that the document is currently scrolled horizontally. This value is subpixel precise in modern browsers, meaning that it isn't necessarily a whole number. You can get the number of pixels the document is scrolled vertically from the scrollY property.
description.text:
The read-only scrollX property of the
  Window interface returns the number of pixels that the document is
  currently scrolled horizontally. This value is subpixel precise in modern browsers,
  meaning that it isn't necessarily a whole number. You can get the number of pixels the
  document is scrolled vertically from the scrollY
  property.

description.html: The afterprint event is fired after the associated document has started printing or the print preview has been closed.
description.text: The afterprint event is fired after the associated document has started printing or the print preview has been closed.

description.html: The Window.closed read-only property indicates whether the referenced window is closed or not.
description.text:
The Window.closed read-only property indicates whether
  the referenced window is closed or not.

description.html: The Window.statusbar property returns the statusbar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.
description.text:
The Window.statusbar property returns the statusbar
  object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

description.html: The global isSecureContext read-only property returns a boolean indicating whether the current context is secure (true) or not (false).
description.text:
The global isSecureContext read-only property returns a boolean indicating whether
  the current context is secure
  (true) or not (false).

description.html: The Window.parent property is a reference to the parent of the current window or subframe.
description.text:
The Window.parent property is a reference to the parent
  of the current window or subframe.

description.html: The auxclick event is fired at an Element when a non-primary pointing device button (any mouse button other than the primary—usually leftmost—button) has been pressed and released both within the same element.
description.text: The auxclick event is fired at an Element when a non-primary pointing device button (any mouse button other than the primary—usually leftmost—button) has been pressed and released both within the same element.

description.html: The read-only innerHeight property of the Window interface returns the interior height of the window in pixels, including the height of the horizontal scroll bar, if present.
description.text:
The read-only innerHeight property of the
  Window interface returns the interior height of the window in pixels,
  including the height of the horizontal scroll bar, if present.

description.html: Secure context: This feature is available only in secure contexts (HTTPS), in some or all supporting browsers.
description.text: Secure context: This feature is available only in secure contexts (HTTPS), in some or all supporting browsers.

description.html: The hashchange event is fired when the fragment identifier of the URL has changed (the part of the URL beginning with and following the # symbol).
description.text: The hashchange event is fired when the fragment identifier of the URL has changed (the part of the URL beginning with and following the # symbol).

description.html: The Window.console property returns a reference to the console object, which provides methods for logging information to the browser's console. These methods are intended for debugging purposes only and should not be relied on for presenting information to end users.
description.text: The Window.console property returns a reference to the console object, which provides methods for logging information to the browser's console. These methods are intended for debugging purposes only and should not be relied on for presenting information to end users.

description.html: The Window.scrollbars property returns the scrollbars object, whose visibility can be checked.
description.text:
The Window.scrollbars property returns the
  scrollbars object, whose visibility can be checked.

description.html:
Experimental: This is an experimental technology
Check the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production.
description.text: Experimental: This is an experimental technologyCheck the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production.

description.html: The window property of a Window object points to the window object itself.
description.text: The window property of a Window object points to the window object itself.

description.html: Note: This feature is available in Web Workers
description.text: Note: This feature is available in Web Workers

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.
description.text: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The mouseup event is fired at an Element when a button on a pointing device (such as a mouse or trackpad) is released while the pointer is located inside it.
description.text: The mouseup event is fired at an Element when a button on a pointing device (such as a mouse or trackpad) is released while the pointer is located inside it.

description.html: The beforeunload event is fired when the window, the document and its resources are about to be unloaded. The document is still visible and the event is still cancelable at this point.
description.text: The beforeunload event is fired when the window, the document and its resources are about to be unloaded. The document is still visible and the event is still cancelable at this point.

description.html: The play event is fired when the paused property is changed from true to false, as a result of the play method, or the autoplay attribute.
description.text: The play event is fired when the paused property is changed from true to false, as a result of the play method, or the autoplay attribute.

description.html: The keydown event is fired when a key is pressed.
description.text: The keydown event is fired when a key is pressed.

description.html: The DOMParser interface provides the ability to parse XML or HTML source code from a string into a DOM Document.
description.text:
The DOMParser interface provides
  the ability to parse XML or HTML source code from a
  string into a DOM Document.

description.html: The offline event of the Window interface is fired when the browser has lost access to the network and the value of Navigator.onLine switches to false.
description.text: The offline event of the Window interface is fired when the browser has lost access to the network and the value of Navigator.onLine switches to false.

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.
description.text: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The gamepadconnected event is fired when the browser detects that a gamepad has been connected or the first time a button/axis of the gamepad is used.
description.text: The gamepadconnected event is fired when the browser detects that a gamepad has been connected or the first time a button/axis of the gamepad is used.

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.
description.text: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The animationiteration event is fired when an iteration of a CSS Animation ends, and another one begins. This event does not occur at the same time as the animationend event, and therefore does not occur for animations with an animation-iteration-count of one.
description.text: The animationiteration event is fired when an iteration of a CSS Animation ends, and another one begins. This event does not occur at the same time as the animationend event, and therefore does not occur for animations with an animation-iteration-count of one.

description.html: The lostpointercapture event is fired when a captured pointer is released.
description.text: The lostpointercapture event is fired when a captured pointer is released.

description.html: The global origin read-only property returns the origin of the global scope, serialized as a string.
description.text:
The global origin read-only property returns the origin of the global
  scope, serialized as a string.

description.html: The keyup event is fired when a key is released.
description.text: The keyup event is fired when a key is released.

description.html: The window.requestIdleCallback() method queues a function to be called during a browser's idle periods. This enables developers to perform background and low priority work on the main event loop, without impacting latency-critical events such as animation and input response. Functions are generally called in first-in-first-out order; however, callbacks which have a timeout specified may be called out-of-order if necessary in order to run them before the timeout elapses.
description.text:
The window.requestIdleCallback() method queues a function
  to be called during a browser's idle periods. This enables developers to perform
  background and low priority work on the main event loop, without impacting
  latency-critical events such as animation and input response. Functions are generally
  called in first-in-first-out order; however, callbacks which have a timeout
  specified may be called out-of-order if necessary in order to run them before the
  timeout elapses.

description.html: The mousedown event is fired at an Element when a pointing device button is pressed while the pointer is inside the element.
description.text: The mousedown event is fired at an Element when a pointing device button is pressed while the pointer is inside the element.

description.html: The animationstart event is fired when a CSS Animation has started. If there is an animation-delay, this event will fire once the delay period has expired. A negative delay will cause the event to fire with an elapsedTime equal to the absolute value of the delay (and, correspondingly, the animation will begin playing at that time index into the sequence).
description.text: The animationstart event is fired when a CSS Animation has started. If there is an animation-delay, this event will fire once the delay period has expired. A negative delay will cause the event to fire with an elapsedTime equal to the absolute value of the delay (and, correspondingly, the animation will begin playing at that time index into the sequence).

description.html: The Window.screenTop read-only property returns the vertical distance, in CSS pixels, from the top border of the user's browser viewport to the top side of the screen.
description.text:
The Window.screenTop read-only property returns the
  vertical distance, in CSS pixels, from the top border of the user's browser viewport to
  the top side of the screen.

description.html: The XMLSerializer interface provides the serializeToString() method to construct an XML string representing a DOM tree.
description.text: The XMLSerializer interface provides the serializeToString() method to construct an XML string representing a DOM tree.

description.html: The mousemove event is fired at an element when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved while the cursor's hotspot is inside it.
description.text: The mousemove event is fired at an element when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved while the cursor's hotspot is inside it.

description.html: The mouseover event is fired at an Element when a pointing device (such as a mouse or trackpad) is used to move the cursor onto the element or one of its child elements.
description.text: The mouseover event is fired at an Element when a pointing device (such as a mouse or trackpad) is used to move the cursor onto the element or one of its child elements.

description.html: The canplaythrough event is fired when the user agent can play the media, and estimates that enough data has been loaded to play the media up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.
description.text: The canplaythrough event is fired when the user agent can play the media, and estimates that enough data has been loaded to play the media up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.

description.html: The animationcancel event is fired when a CSS Animation unexpectedly aborts. In other words, any time it stops running without sending an animationend event. This might happen when the animation-name is changed such that the animation is removed, or when the animating node is hidden using CSS. Therefore, either directly or because any of its containing nodes are hidden.
description.text: The animationcancel event is fired when a CSS Animation unexpectedly aborts. In other words, any time it stops running without sending an animationend event. This might happen when the animation-name is changed such that the animation is removed, or when the animating node is hidden using CSS. Therefore, either directly or because any of its containing nodes are hidden.

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.
description.text: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The transitionstart event is fired when a CSS transition has actually started, i.e., after any transition-delay has ended.
description.text: The transitionstart event is fired when a CSS transition has actually started, i.e., after any transition-delay has ended.

description.html: The addEventListener() method of the EventTarget interface sets up a function that will be called whenever the specified event is delivered to the target.
description.text:
The addEventListener() method of the EventTarget interface
  sets up a function that will be called whenever the specified event is delivered to the target.

description.html: The setInterval() method, offered on the Window and Worker interfaces, repeatedly calls a function or executes a code snippet, with a fixed time delay between each call.
description.text:
The setInterval() method,
  offered on the Window and Worker interfaces, repeatedly
  calls a function or executes a code snippet, with a fixed time delay between each
  call.

description.html: The Storage interface of the Web Storage API provides access to a particular domain's session or local storage. It allows, for example, the addition, modification, or deletion of stored data items.
description.text: The Storage interface of the Web Storage API provides access to a particular domain's session or local storage. It allows, for example, the addition, modification, or deletion of stored data items.

description.html: The durationchange event is fired when the duration attribute has been updated.
description.text: The durationchange event is fired when the duration attribute has been updated.

description.html: The Window.location read-only property returns a Location object with information about the current location of the document.
description.text:
The Window.location read-only property returns a
  Location object with information about the current location of the
  document.

description.html: The Image() constructor creates a new HTMLImageElement instance. It is functionally equivalent to document.createElement('img').
description.text:
The Image()
  constructor creates a new HTMLImageElement instance. It is functionally
  equivalent to document.createElement('img').

description.html: The contextmenu event fires when the user attempts to open a context menu. This event is typically triggered by clicking the right mouse button, or by pressing the context menu key.
description.text: The contextmenu event fires when the user attempts to open a context menu. This event is typically triggered by clicking the right mouse button, or by pressing the context menu key.

description.html: The window.requestAnimationFrame() method tells the browser that you wish to perform an animation and requests that the browser calls a specified function to update an animation before the next repaint. The method takes a callback as an argument to be invoked before the repaint.
description.text:
The window.requestAnimationFrame() method tells the
  browser that you wish to perform an animation and requests that the browser calls a
  specified function to update an animation before the next repaint. The method takes a
  callback as an argument to be invoked before the repaint.

description.html: The gotpointercapture event is fired when an element captures a pointer using setPointerCapture().
description.text: The gotpointercapture event is fired when an element captures a pointer using setPointerCapture().

description.html: The mouseenter event is fired at an Element when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is initially moved so that its hotspot is within the element at which the event was fired.
description.text: The mouseenter event is fired at an Element when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is initially moved so that its hotspot is within the element at which the event was fired.

description.html: The pointerover event is fired when a pointing device is moved into an element's hit test boundaries.
description.text: The pointerover event is fired when a pointing device is moved into an element's hit test boundaries.

description.html: The global performance property returns a Performance object, which can be used to gather performance information about the context it is called in (window or worker).
description.text: The global performance property returns a Performance object, which can be used to gather performance information about the context it is called in (window or worker).

description.html: The storage event of the Window interface fires when a storage area (localStorage) has been modified in the context of another document.
description.text: The storage event of the Window interface fires when a storage area (localStorage) has been modified in the context of another document.

description.html: The pointerleave event is fired when a pointing device is moved out of the hit test boundaries of an element. For pen devices, this event is fired when the stylus leaves the hover range detectable by the digitizer.
description.text: The pointerleave event is fired when a pointing device is moved out of the hit test boundaries of an element. For pen devices, this event is fired when the stylus leaves the hover range detectable by the digitizer.

description.html: The pointerout event is fired for several reasons including: pointing device is moved out of the hit test boundaries of an element; firing the pointerup event for a device that does not support hover (see pointerup); after firing the pointercancel event (see pointercancel); when a pen stylus leaves the hover range detectable by the digitizer.
description.text: The pointerout event is fired for several reasons including: pointing device is moved out of the hit test boundaries of an element; firing the pointerup event for a device that does not support hover (see pointerup); after firing the pointercancel event (see pointercancel); when a pen stylus leaves the hover range detectable by the digitizer.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The emptied event is fired when the media has become empty; for example, this event is sent if the media has already been loaded (or partially loaded), and the load() method is called to reload it.
description.text: The emptied event is fired when the media has become empty; for example, this event is sent if the media has already been loaded (or partially loaded), and the load() method is called to reload it.

description.html: The pause event is sent when a request to pause an activity is handled and the activity has entered its paused state, most commonly after the media has been paused through a call to the element's pause() method.
description.text: The pause event is sent when a request to pause an activity is handled and the activity has entered its paused state, most commonly after the media has been paused through a call to the element's pause() method.

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.
description.text: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The select event fires when some text has been selected.
description.text: The select event fires when some text has been selected.

description.html: The global indexedDB read-only property provides a mechanism for applications to asynchronously access the capabilities of indexed databases.
description.text:
The global indexedDB read-only property provides a mechanism for applications to
  asynchronously access the capabilities of indexed databases.

description.html: The pointerenter event fires when a pointing device is moved into the hit test boundaries of an element or one of its descendants, including as a result of a pointerdown event from a device that does not support hover (see pointerdown).
description.text: The pointerenter event fires when a pointing device is moved into the hit test boundaries of an element or one of its descendants, including as a result of a pointerdown event from a device that does not support hover (see pointerdown).

description.html: The timeupdate event is fired when the time indicated by the currentTime attribute has been updated.
description.text: The timeupdate event is fired when the time indicated by the currentTime attribute has been updated.

description.html: The loadeddata event is fired when the frame at the current playback position of the media has finished loading; often the first frame.
description.text: The loadeddata event is fired when the frame at the current playback position of the media has finished loading; often the first frame.

description.html: The suspend event is fired when media data loading has been suspended.
description.text: The suspend event is fired when media data loading has been suspended.

description.html: The seeked event is fired when a seek operation completed, the current playback position has changed, and the Boolean seeking attribute is changed to false.
description.text: The seeked event is fired when a seek operation completed, the current playback position has changed, and the Boolean seeking attribute is changed to false.

description.html: The progress event is fired periodically as the browser loads a resource.
description.text: The progress event is fired periodically as the browser loads a resource.

description.html: The wheel event fires when the user rotates a wheel button on a pointing device (typically a mouse).
description.text: The wheel event fires when the user rotates a wheel button on a pointing device (typically a mouse).

description.html: The ended event is fired when playback or streaming has stopped because the end of the media was reached or because no further data is available.
description.text: The ended event is fired when playback or streaming has stopped because the end of the media was reached or because no further data is available.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: Secure context: This feature is available only in secure contexts (HTTPS), in some or all supporting browsers.
description.text: Secure context: This feature is available only in secure contexts (HTTPS), in some or all supporting browsers.

description.html: The invalid event fires when a submittable element has been checked for validity and doesn't satisfy its constraints.
description.text: The invalid event fires when a submittable element has been checked for validity and doesn't satisfy its constraints.

description.html: Window.outerWidth read-only property returns the width of the outside of the browser window. It represents the width of the whole browser window including sidebar (if expanded), window chrome and window resizing borders/handles.
description.text: Window.outerWidth read-only property returns the width of the outside of the browser window. It represents the width of the whole browser window including sidebar (if expanded), window chrome and window resizing borders/handles.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

description.html: The Option() constructor creates a new HTMLOptionElement.
description.text:
The Option() constructor creates a new
  HTMLOptionElement.

description.html:
Experimental: This is an experimental technology
Check the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production.
description.text: Experimental: This is an experimental technologyCheck the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production.

description.html: The deviceorientation event is fired when fresh data is available from an orientation sensor about the current orientation of the device as compared to the Earth coordinate frame. This data is gathered from a magnetometer inside the device.
description.text: The deviceorientation event is fired when fresh data is available from an orientation sensor about the current orientation of the device as compared to the Earth coordinate frame. This data is gathered from a magnetometer inside the device.

description.html: The playing event is fired after playback is first started, and whenever it is restarted. For example it is fired when playback resumes after having been paused or delayed due to lack of data.
description.text: The playing event is fired after playback is first started, and whenever it is restarted. For example it is fired when playback resumes after having been paused or delayed due to lack of data.

description.html: The abort event is fired when the resource was not fully loaded, but not as the result of an error.
description.text: The abort event is fired when the resource was not fully loaded, but not as the result of an error.

description.html: The loadstart event is fired when the browser has started to load a resource.
description.text: The loadstart event is fired when the browser has started to load a resource.

description.html: The pointerup event is fired when a pointer is no longer active.
description.text: The pointerup event is fired when a pointer is no longer active.

description.html: The ratechange event is fired when the playback rate has changed.
description.text: The ratechange event is fired when the playback rate has changed.

description.html: The dragleave event is fired when a dragged element or text selection leaves a valid drop target.
description.text: The dragleave event is fired when a dragged element or text selection leaves a valid drop target.

description.html: The canplay event is fired when the user agent can play the media, but estimates that not enough data has been loaded to play the media up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.
description.text: The canplay event is fired when the user agent can play the media, but estimates that not enough data has been loaded to play the media up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.

description.html: The dispatchEvent() method of the EventTarget sends an Event to the object, (synchronously) invoking the affected EventListeners in the appropriate order. The normal event processing rules (including the capturing and optional bubbling phase) also apply to events dispatched manually with dispatchEvent().
description.text:
The dispatchEvent() method of the EventTarget sends an Event to the object, (synchronously) invoking the affected
  EventListeners in the appropriate order. The normal event processing
  rules (including the capturing and optional bubbling phase) also apply to events
  dispatched manually with dispatchEvent().

description.html: The seeking event is fired when a seek operation starts, meaning the Boolean seeking attribute has changed to true and the media is seeking a new position.
description.text: The seeking event is fired when a seek operation starts, meaning the Boolean seeking attribute has changed to true and the media is seeking a new position.

description.html: The volumechange event is fired when the volume has changed.
description.text: The volumechange event is fired when the volume has changed.

description.html: The dragstart event is fired when the user starts dragging an element or text selection.
description.text: The dragstart event is fired when the user starts dragging an element or text selection.

description.html: The pageshow event is sent to a Window when the browser displays the window's document due to navigation.
description.text: The pageshow event is sent to a Window when the browser displays the window's document due to navigation.

description.html: The input event fires when the value of an <input>, <select>, or <textarea> element has been changed.
description.text: The input event fires when the value of an <input>, <select>, or <textarea> element has been changed.

description.html: The mouseout event is fired at an Element when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is used to move the cursor so that it is no longer contained within the element or one of its children.
description.text: The mouseout event is fired at an Element when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is used to move the cursor so that it is no longer contained within the element or one of its children.

description.html: The online event of the Window interface is fired when the browser has gained access to the network and the value of Navigator.onLine switches to true.
description.text: The online event of the Window interface is fired when the browser has gained access to the network and the value of Navigator.onLine switches to true.

description.html: The dragenter event is fired when a dragged element or text selection enters a valid drop target.
description.text: The dragenter event is fired when a dragged element or text selection enters a valid drop target.

description.html: The pointermove event is fired when a pointer changes coordinates, and the pointer has not been canceled by a browser touch-action.
description.text: The pointermove event is fired when a pointer changes coordinates, and the pointer has not been canceled by a browser touch-action.

description.html: The scroll event fires when an element has been scrolled. To detect when scrolling has completed, see the Element: scrollend event.
description.text:
The scroll event fires when an element has been scrolled.
  To detect when scrolling has completed, see the Element: scrollend event.

description.html: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.
description.text: Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

description.html: The dragend event is fired when a drag operation is being ended (by releasing a mouse button or hitting the escape key).
description.text: The dragend event is fired when a drag operation is being ended (by releasing a mouse button or hitting the escape key).

description.html: The Worker interface of the Web Workers API represents a background task that can be created via script, which can send messages back to its creator.
description.text: The Worker interface of the Web Workers API represents a background task that can be created via script, which can send messages back to its creator.

description.html: The loadedmetadata event is fired when the metadata has been loaded.
description.text: The loadedmetadata event is fired when the metadata has been loaded.

description.html: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
description.text: Non-standard: This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
