description.html: The submit event fires when a <form> is submitted.
description.text: The submit event fires when a <form> is submitted.

description.html: The formdata event fires after the entry list representing the form's data is constructed. This happens when the form is submitted, but can also be triggered by the invocation of a FormData() constructor.
description.text: The formdata event fires after the entry list representing the form's data is constructed. This happens when the form is submitted, but can also be triggered by the invocation of a FormData() constructor.

description.html: The localStorage read-only property of the window interface allows you to access a Storage object for the Document's origin; the stored data is saved across browser sessions.
description.text: The localStorage read-only property of the window interface allows you to access a Storage object for the Document's origin; the stored data is saved across browser sessions.

description.html: The waiting event is fired when playback has stopped because of a temporary lack of data.
description.text: The waiting event is fired when playback has stopped because of a temporary lack of data.

description.html: The change event is fired for <input>, <select>, and <textarea> elements when the user modifies the element's value. Unlike the input event, the change event is not necessarily fired for each alteration to an element's value.
description.text: The change event is fired for <input>, <select>, and <textarea> elements when the user modifies the element's value. Unlike the input event, the change event is not necessarily fired for each alteration to an element's value.

description.html: The beforeprint event is fired when the associated document is about to be printed or previewed for printing.
description.text: The beforeprint event is fired when the associated document is about to be printed or previewed for printing.

description.html: The drag event is fired every few hundred milliseconds as an element or text selection is being dragged by the user.
description.text: The drag event is fired every few hundred milliseconds as an element or text selection is being dragged by the user.

description.html: The selectstart event of the Selection API is fired when a user starts a new selection.
description.text: The selectstart event of the Selection API is fired when a user starts a new selection.

description.html:
This method is used to break up long running operations and run a callback function
  immediately after the browser has completed other operations such as events and display
  updates.
description.text:
This method is used to break up long running operations and run a callback function
  immediately after the browser has completed other operations such as events and display
  updates.

description.html: The global read-only scheduler property is the entry point for using the Prioritized Task Scheduling API.
description.text: The global read-only scheduler property is the entry point for using the Prioritized Task Scheduling API.

description.html: The reset event fires when a <form> is reset.
description.text: The reset event fires when a <form> is reset.

description.html: The dragover event is fired when an element or text selection is being dragged over a valid drop target (every few hundred milliseconds).
description.text: The dragover event is fired when an element or text selection is being dragged over a valid drop target (every few hundred milliseconds).

description.html: The stalled event is fired when the user agent is trying to fetch media data, but data is unexpectedly not forthcoming.
description.text: The stalled event is fired when the user agent is trying to fetch media data, but data is unexpectedly not forthcoming.

description.html: The slotchange event is fired on an HTMLSlotElement instance (<slot> element) when the node(s) contained in that slot change.
description.text: The slotchange event is fired on an HTMLSlotElement instance (<slot> element) when the node(s) contained in that slot change.

description.html: The speechSynthesis read-only property of the Window object returns a SpeechSynthesis object, which is the entry point into using Web Speech API speech synthesis functionality.
description.text: The speechSynthesis read-only property of the Window object returns a SpeechSynthesis object, which is the entry point into using Web Speech API speech synthesis functionality.

description.html: The pointercancel event is fired when the browser determines that there are unlikely to be any more pointer events, or if after the pointerdown event is fired, the pointer is then used to manipulate the viewport by panning, zooming, or scrolling.
description.text: The pointercancel event is fired when the browser determines that there are unlikely to be any more pointer events, or if after the pointerdown event is fired, the pointer is then used to manipulate the viewport by panning, zooming, or scrolling.

description.html: The cuechange event fires when a TextTrack has changed the currently displaying cues. The event is fired on both the TextTrack and the HTMLTrackElement in which it's being presented, if any.
description.text: The cuechange event fires when a TextTrack has changed the currently displaying cues. The event is fired on both the TextTrack and the HTMLTrackElement in which it's being presented, if any.

description.html: The drop event is fired when an element or text selection is dropped on a valid drop target.
description.text: The drop event is fired when an element or text selection is dropped on a valid drop target.

description.html: The DOM beforeinput event fires when the value of an <input>, or <textarea> element is about to be modified. The event also applies to elements with contenteditable enabled, and to any element when designMode is turned on.
description.text: The DOM beforeinput event fires when the value of an <input>, or <textarea> element is about to be modified. The event also applies to elements with contenteditable enabled, and to any element when designMode is turned on.

description.html: The close event is fired on an HTMLDialogElement object when the <dialog> it represents has been closed.
description.text: The close event is fired on an HTMLDialogElement object when the <dialog> it represents has been closed.
